alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 10:08AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Monterey. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Arroyo Seco, Soledad, Greenfield, Gonzales, Carmel Valley Village, Chualar, Cachagua Near The Los Padres Dam, San Clemente Dam, Sycamore Flat, Spreckels, Boronda and Prunedale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
